tasks.title: Project Setup Complete
tasks.description: Infinite continue hook system has been initialized and is ready for use
success_criteria: Hook system configured
Mode files available
Project structure created

tasks.title: Begin Development Work
tasks.description: Start implementing your project features using the infinite continue system
success_criteria: First feature implemented
Basic tests added
Code quality maintained

tasks.title: Review Unnecessary Files
tasks.description: Identify and remove any unnecessary files including unused dependencies, temporary files, build artifacts, and outdated documentation
success_criteria: All temporary and build files identified and removed
Unused dependencies removed from package files
Outdated documentation files cleaned up
Project directory contains only necessary files

tasks.title: Review Unimplemented Source Code
tasks.description: Find and complete any unimplemented source code including TODO comments, stub functions, placeholder methods, and incomplete features
success_criteria: All TODO comments reviewed and resolved
No stub functions or placeholder methods remain
All incomplete features are either completed or documented as future work
Code is production-ready with no implementation gaps

tasks.title: Review Test Errors and Skipped Tests
tasks.description: Fix all failing tests and implement any skipped or pending tests to ensure comprehensive test coverage
success_criteria: All test suites pass without errors
No skipped or pending tests remain
Test failures are fixed without breaking functionality
Test suite runs cleanly in CI/CD environment

tasks.title: Review Missing Test Coverage
tasks.description: Identify and add tests for any code paths with missing coverage to reach the 95% coverage target
success_criteria: Code coverage reaches 95% target
All critical code paths have test coverage
Edge cases and error conditions are tested
Coverage report shows no significant gaps

tasks.title: Strike 1/3: Initial Completion Review
tasks.description: Perform comprehensive review of all completion criteria. Identify any gaps in documentation, features, testing, or code quality that prevent true project completion.
success_criteria: All 4 completion criteria areas assessed (docs, features, tests, quality)
Gap analysis completed with specific issues identified
Priority areas for final cleanup identified
Verification documented with evidence of review depth

tasks.title: Strike 2/3: Detailed Gap Resolution
tasks.description: Address specific gaps identified in Strike 1 review. Focus on resolving documentation gaps, completing missing features, improving test coverage, and fixing quality issues.
success_criteria: All previously identified gaps addressed or documented as acceptable
Documentation updated to reflect current implementation state
Test coverage meets or exceeds stated requirements
Code quality issues resolved or explicitly accepted

tasks.title: Strike 3/3: Final Validation and Approval
tasks.description: Perform final comprehensive validation that project meets all completion criteria. This is the last chance to identify any issues before project approval.
success_criteria: All completion criteria demonstrably met with evidence
Project genuinely ready for production/delivery
No critical gaps remain in any area
Final sign-off provided with confidence in project completion

tasks.title: Research ERA5/Copernicus CDS API Integration
tasks.description: Comprehensive research on ERA5 data access via Copernicus Climate Data Store (CDS) API including authentication, data formats, rate limits, and best practices
success_criteria: CDS API authentication requirements and setup documented
ERA5 available variables and temporal/spatial resolutions catalogued
API rate limits, quotas, and usage patterns identified
Data formats (NetCDF, GRIB) and processing requirements understood
Example Python code for data retrieval working
Production implementation strategy documented

tasks.title: Implement ERA5 Climate Data Ingestion Service
tasks.description: Build automated data ingestion service for ERA5 temperature and climate data from Copernicus Climate Data Store (CDS) based on research findings
success_criteria: ERA5 API client implemented with authentication
Temperature data (2m, min, max) automatically downloaded
Data validation and quality checks implemented
Automated daily/monthly data updates working
Comprehensive tests with high coverage
Integration with existing CLI and models

tasks.title: Research CHIRPS Rainfall Data Access Methods
tasks.description: Investigate CHIRPS precipitation data access including FTP servers, data formats, processing workflows, and integration patterns
success_criteria: CHIRPS data sources and access methods documented
Data formats (NetCDF, GeoTIFF, binary) and structures analyzed
Temporal/spatial resolutions and coverage areas mapped
Download automation approaches and tools identified
Data processing and extraction workflows designed
Production implementation strategy documented

tasks.title: Implement CHIRPS Rainfall Data Ingestion Service
tasks.description: Build automated ingestion for CHIRPS (Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station data) rainfall data based on research findings
success_criteria: CHIRPS data download service implemented
NetCDF/GeoTIFF processing pipeline created
Rainfall data extracted for target regions
Data harmonization with ERA5 timestamps
Comprehensive tests with high coverage
Integration with existing systems

tasks.title: Research Malaria Atlas Project (MAP) Data Access
tasks.description: Study MAP's data access methods, APIs, raster data formats, and vector surveillance data structures for malaria risk mapping
success_criteria: MAP data portal and API endpoints documented
Available malaria datasets and risk maps catalogued
Raster data formats and coordinate systems understood
Vector occurrence data structure and metadata analyzed
Programmatic access methods and rate limits identified
Production implementation strategy documented

tasks.title: Implement Malaria Atlas Project Data Integration
tasks.description: Integrate historical malaria risk maps and incidence data from Malaria Atlas Project (MAP) based on research findings
success_criteria: MAP API integration implemented
Historical malaria risk raster data imported
Vector occurrence data processed
Baseline risk maps for model training prepared
Comprehensive tests with high coverage
Integration with existing systems

tasks.title: Research WorldPop Population Data Integration
tasks.description: Analyze WorldPop's population data access including APIs, data formats, resolution options, and demographic variables available
success_criteria: WorldPop API and data portal access methods documented
Population dataset types and resolutions catalogued
Demographic variables (age, gender) availability assessed
Raster data formats and processing requirements understood
Integration with other geospatial data sources planned
Production implementation strategy documented

tasks.title: Implement WorldPop Population Data Integration
tasks.description: Integrate WorldPop population density and demographics data for population-at-risk calculations based on research findings
success_criteria: WorldPop data download service implemented
Population density rasters processed
Age-structured population data integrated
Population-at-risk metrics calculated
Comprehensive tests with high coverage
Integration with existing systems

tasks.title: Research MODIS Data Access via NASA EarthData
tasks.description: Investigate MODIS vegetation indices (NDVI/EVI) access through NASA EarthData including authentication, data formats, and processing tools
success_criteria: NASA EarthData authentication and access setup documented
MODIS products (MOD13, MYD13) and resolutions identified
NDVI/EVI data formats (HDF, NetCDF) and metadata understood
Cloud masking and quality assessment procedures documented
Automated download tools and Python libraries evaluated
Production implementation strategy documented

tasks.title: Implement MODIS Vegetation Indices Data Pipeline
tasks.description: Build pipeline for MODIS NDVI/EVI vegetation indices data from NASA Earth Data based on research findings
success_criteria: NASA Earth Data API authentication setup
MODIS NDVI/EVI data download automated
Cloud masking and quality filtering implemented
16-day composite processing pipeline working
Comprehensive tests with high coverage
Integration with existing systems
